page.title: 12THE MULTI - ROUNDABOUT
page.content: This original multi - roundabout was designed to aid traffic flow. The roundabout is the junction of six roads of varying importance which link Hemel Hempstead with St. Albans, Leighton Buzzard, Berkhamsted, Watford and the M1. The roundabout is designed with a large central area of grass, and a small mini - rounabout at each road end. The priciple of traffic flow is based on priority always being given to traffic coming from the right. A driver approaching the main roundabout need not necessarily go round it. He can utilise the mini - roundabout in order to go towards an exit road on his right without having to circuit the whole roundabout. Traffic distance is cut down and flow speeded up by the use of the little satellite roundabouts.
